answers.answer: It depends on your body type and pre pregnancy weight.... Everyone's different....
Here they say 12-15kgs but it completely depends on your BMI prior to pregnancy. I was already overweight so I supposedly shouldn't put on more then 9kgs.

I didn't start putting on weight till about 6 months I kept fluctuating between 4-6 pounds. If ur over weight before prego they say 10-20 but I've already reached 20 nw tht I'm 31 weeks its alil assesive but long as u don't have diabetes or high blood pressure u.should be good..I kno a lot of first time moms who gained ne where from 35-60 pounds sounds like a lot but is all good long as u n ur baby healthy ur good..docs can be alil harsh sometimes but those I request nt to see anymore lol.. good luck
My pre pregnancy weight was Only 106. I'm not super tall either. I'm almost 37 weeks now and I've gained 44 lbs. The weight is mostly on my belly and bum
thanks everyone i have put 7 pounds on so far and was just wondering if thats ok my bmi is in range at 20 well was before pregnant lol :-) but i suppose all the weight gain will be worth it x

question: does any of you ladies know what the average normal weight gain you put on throughout pregnancy? im a ftm and 19+2 weeks pregnant x
title: weight
